key_points: An image purportedly showing the Ever Given cargo ship making a route that resembles a crude drawing of a penis is mostly true.
The image is a genuine representation of the Ever Given's route before it got stuck in the Suez Canal.
There's no evidence to suggest the ship's route was intentionally designed to resemble a crude drawing.
The Ever Given blocked the Suez Canal on March 23, 2021, disrupting global shipping traffic.
The route image was circulated on social media following the incident.
VesselFinder.com, a vessel-trafficking service provider, created a video simulation showing the ship's movements before the incident.
Vessel Finder's spokesperson confirmed to Vice the route was genuine and dismissed conspiracy theories.
Myshiptracking.com also shows the Ever Given's route resembling a NSFW drawing.
CNN reported that eight tugboats were trying to free the Ever Given, indicating significant disruption to the Suez Canal traffic.
"There's no room for some kind of conspiracies or false data," says the spokesperson for Vesselfinder.com.
